Reason: The 'key_cache_save_period' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it determines how often the key cache is saved to disk. A lower value for this configuration can result in more frequent disk writes, impacting system performance by increasing I/O operations and potentially causing delays in data retrieval. Conversely, a higher value can lead to less frequent disk writes but may result in increased memory consumption as more data is held in memory instead of being saved to disk. Therefore, changes to the 'key_cache_save_period' configuration can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and memory usage.
